title: 2 Corinthians Chapter 11 Quiz - Multi-Level
description: An enhanced quiz on 2 Corinthians chapter 11 with Easy, Medium, Hard, and Theological levels. Each level has 15 carefully crafted questions. Choose your difficulty and dive in!

easy.title: 2 Corinthians Chapter 11 Quiz - Easy Level
easy.description: Perfect for beginners! Test your basic knowledge of 2 Corinthians Chapter 11.

questions.question: According to 2 Corinthians 11:2, to whom has Paul espoused the believers?
questions.explanation: Paul states he has espoused the believers to one husband, that he may present them as a chaste virgin to Christ (2 Corinthians 11:2).

questions.question: What does Paul fear might corrupt the minds of the believers according to 2 Corinthians 11:3?
options: The simplicity that is in Christ
questions.explanation: Paul fears that just as the serpent beguiled Eve by his subtilty, the believers' minds might be corrupted from the simplicity that is in Christ (2 Corinthians 11:3).

questions.question: According to 2 Corinthians 11:4, what should believers do if someone preaches another Jesus or another gospel?
questions.explanation: Paul says that if someone preaches another Jesus or gospel, the believers might well bear with him (2 Corinthians 11:4).

questions.question: In 2 Corinthians 11:7, what did Paul do to exalt the Corinthians?
questions.explanation: Paul asks if he committed an offence in abasing himself so that the Corinthians might be exalted because he preached the gospel freely (2 Corinthians 11:7).

questions.question: Who supplied Paul when he was present with the Corinthians and was in want, according to 2 Corinthians 11:9?
questions.explanation: Paul explains that the brethren who came from Macedonia supplied what was lacking to him when he was present with the Corinthians (2 Corinthians 11:9).

questions.question: What kind of apostles does Paul warn the Corinthians about in 2 Corinthians 11:13?
questions.explanation: Paul warns that some are false apostles and deceitful workers, transforming themselves into apostles of Christ (2 Corinthians 11:13).

questions.question: According to 2 Corinthians 11:14, into what does Satan transform himself?
questions.explanation: Paul states that Satan himself is transformed into an angel of light (2 Corinthians 11:14).

questions.question: How does Paul describe his speech in 2 Corinthians 11:6?
options: Rude in speech but not in knowledge
questions.correctAnswer: Rude in speech but not in knowledge
questions.explanation: Paul says he may be rude in speech but not in knowledge, and they have been thoroughly made manifest among the Corinthians (2 Corinthians 11:6).

questions.question: How many times did Paul receive forty stripes save one from the Jews according to 2 Corinthians 11:24?
questions.explanation: Paul states he received forty stripes save one from the Jews five times (2 Corinthians 11:24).

questions.question: Where was Paul let down in a basket to escape, as mentioned in 2 Corinthians 11:33?
questions.explanation: Paul was let down through a window in a basket by the wall of Damascus to escape (2 Corinthians 11:33).

questions.question: True or False: In 2 Corinthians 11:11, Paul asks if he does not love the Corinthians.
questions.explanation: Paul asks 'Wherefore? because I love you not? God knoweth' indicating he does love them (2 Corinthians 11:11).

questions.question: True or False: According to 2 Corinthians 11:23, Paul considers himself less of a minister of Christ than others.
questions.explanation: Paul says, 'Are they ministers of Christ? I am more' showing he considers himself more abundant in labours (2 Corinthians 11:23).

questions.question: True or False: 2 Corinthians 11:19 states that the Corinthians are wise and do not suffer fools gladly.
questions.explanation: Paul says the Corinthians suffer fools gladly because they themselves are wise (2 Corinthians 11:19), so the statement is false.

questions.question: Complete the verse from 2 Corinthians 11:28: 'Beside those things that are without, that which cometh upon me daily, the care of all the ______.'
questions.explanation: Paul speaks about the daily care of all the churches (2 Corinthians 11:28).

questions.question: Complete the verse from 2 Corinthians 11:32: 'In Damascus the governor under ______ the king kept the city of the Damascenes with a garrison.'
questions.explanation: Paul mentions the governor under Aretas the king kept the city of the Damascenes (2 Corinthians 11:32).

medium.title: 2 Corinthians Chapter 11 Quiz - Medium Level
medium.description: Ready for more? Apply biblical truths from 2 Corinthians Chapter 11 to real-life situations.

questions.question: A fellow believer is struggling with false teachings in their church. Based on 2 Corinthians 11, what biblical truth would you share about discerning true apostles?
options: False apostles disguise themselves as servants of righteousness
All who preach are true apostles
Only apostles who perform miracles are true
questions.correctAnswer: False apostles disguise themselves as servants of righteousness
questions.explanation: 2 Corinthians 11:13-15 warns that false apostles are deceitful workers who transform themselves into apostles of Christ and resemble ministers of righteousness, but their end will match their works.

questions.question: How does 2 Corinthians 11 teach us about humility and contentment in ministry through Paul's example of support?
options: Paul refused to be a burden and accepted help from other believers when needed
Paul demanded payment from all churches he served
Paul boasted about his wealth to gain respect
Paul worked only when paid by the Corinthians
questions.correctAnswer: Paul refused to be a burden and accepted help from other believers when needed
questions.explanation: 2 Corinthians 11:8-9 shows Paul did not charge the Corinthians but was supported by brethren from Macedonia, demonstrating humility and contentment by not being burdensome.

questions.question: A believer feels weak and discouraged by trials. According to 2 Corinthians 11, what truth about perseverance can you share?
options: Paul endured many hardships and kept caring for the churches despite his weakness
Perseverance is only for the strongest believers
questions.correctAnswer: Paul endured many hardships and kept caring for the churches despite his weakness
questions.explanation: Verses 23-29 describe Paul’s many sufferings and daily burden for the churches, showing perseverance through trials as an example of faithful service.

questions.question: How does 2 Corinthians 11 instruct believers on guarding their hearts against deception?
options: Believers should watch for those preaching another Jesus or gospel
Trust every new teaching without question
Ignore teachings that differ from tradition
Only listen to leaders who are wealthy
questions.correctAnswer: Believers should watch for those preaching another Jesus or gospel
questions.explanation: Verses 3-4 caution believers about being beguiled like Eve and receiving another Jesus or gospel different from what was preached.

questions.question: What biblical principle about love and jealousy for the church does Paul express in 2 Corinthians 11?
options: Paul expresses godly jealousy to protect the church’s purity for Christ
Paul encourages jealousy as a worldly emotion
Paul advises indifference toward church purity
questions.correctAnswer: Paul expresses godly jealousy to protect the church’s purity for Christ
questions.explanation: 2 Corinthians 11:2 speaks of Paul’s godly jealousy as he espoused the church to one husband, Christ, desiring them to be presented as a chaste virgin.

questions.question: Based on 2 Corinthians 11, what is a proper attitude toward boasting in ministry?
options: Boast only in your weaknesses and sufferings for Christ
questions.correctAnswer: Boast only in your weaknesses and sufferings for Christ
questions.explanation: Paul in 2 Corinthians 11:30 declares he will boast of his infirmities, showing humility and dependence on God rather than worldly achievements.

questions.question: How does Paul model integrity and honesty in his work among the Corinthians according to 2 Corinthians 11?
options: He preached the gospel freely without seeking wages from them
He demanded payment from the Corinthians
He refused to work and lived off others
questions.correctAnswer: He preached the gospel freely without seeking wages from them
questions.explanation: 2 Corinthians 11:7-8 explains Paul did not take wages from the Corinthians but even took support from other churches to serve them freely.

questions.question: True or False: According to 2 Corinthians 11, Satan and his ministers can appear as angels and ministers of light.
questions.explanation: 2 Corinthians 11:14-15 states that Satan transforms himself into an angel of light, and his ministers also appear as ministers of righteousness.

questions.question: True or False: Paul claims he is less bold and suffers less than other apostles according to 2 Corinthians 11.
questions.explanation: Paul claims in 2 Corinthians 11:5 and 22-23 that he is not behind the chief apostles and has endured more labors and sufferings than many.

questions.question: Fill in the blank: Paul fears that your minds may be corrupted from the simplicity that is in _______.
questions.explanation: 2 Corinthians 11:3 expresses Paul's fear that the minds of the believers might be corrupted from the simplicity in Christ, similar to how Eve was beguiled.

questions.question: How does 2 Corinthians 11 illustrate the importance of serving others with humility in church fellowship?
options: Paul humbled himself to exalt the Corinthians by freely preaching the gospel
Paul demanded honor from the church members
Paul avoided serving to protect his reputation
Paul only served when recognized publicly
questions.correctAnswer: Paul humbled himself to exalt the Corinthians by freely preaching the gospel
questions.explanation: 2 Corinthians 11:6-7 shows Paul’s willingness to be 'rude in speech' but rich in knowledge and to humble himself for the benefit of the church.

questions.question: What example does Paul give in 2 Corinthians 11 to teach perseverance through physical hardship?
options: He experienced beatings, shipwrecks, hunger, and imprisonment but remained faithful
He avoided all hardships by staying safe
He only preached in comfortable places
He refused to suffer for the gospel
questions.correctAnswer: He experienced beatings, shipwrecks, hunger, and imprisonment but remained faithful
questions.explanation: Verses 23-27 detail Paul’s many sufferings including stripes, shipwrecks, imprisonments, hunger, and more, demonstrating perseverance.

questions.question: According to 2 Corinthians 11, how should believers respond to those who bring bondage or mistreat them in the name of faith?
options: Recognize such behavior as foolishness and be bold as Paul was
questions.correctAnswer: Recognize such behavior as foolishness and be bold as Paul was
questions.explanation: 2 Corinthians 11:20-21 Paul speaks of suffering reproach and boldness, indicating believers should be aware and bold rather than passive.

questions.question: What does Paul’s escape from Damascus teach us about trusting God’s deliverance in trials?
options: God can provide unexpected means of deliverance even in dire situations
Only physical strength can save us
questions.correctAnswer: God can provide unexpected means of deliverance even in dire situations
questions.explanation: 2 Corinthians 11:32-33 recounts Paul’s being let down in a basket through a window to escape, showing God’s providential care.

questions.question: How does Paul view boasting according to 2 Corinthians 11 when it comes to spiritual matters?
options: He boasts only to defend the truth and expose false teachers
He boasts to exalt himself over others
He never boasts under any circumstance
questions.correctAnswer: He boasts only to defend the truth and expose false teachers
questions.explanation: In verses 16-18, Paul explains he boasts as a fool to counter those who glory after the flesh and to defend the gospel truth.

hard.title: 2 Corinthians Chapter 11 Quiz - Hard Level
hard.description: Challenge yourself with deep analysis and cross-biblical connections from 2 Corinthians Chapter 11.

questions.question: Paul expresses a godly jealousy over the Corinthians because he has espoused them to one husband. Who is this 'one husband'?
questions.explanation: Paul refers to Christ as the 'one husband' to whom the Corinthians are espoused, symbolizing their exclusive devotion (2 Corinthians 11:2).

questions.question: Paul fears that the minds of the Corinthians might be corrupted from the simplicity of Christ, just as whom was beguiled by the serpent?
questions.explanation: Paul draws a typological parallel between the Corinthians and Eve, who was beguiled by the serpent, indicating the danger of being led away from the gospel (2 Corinthians 11:3).

questions.question: Paul warns against receiving another gospel or another spirit. What is the consequence he implies if they do?
options: They might well bear with him
questions.correctAnswer: They might well bear with him
questions.explanation: Paul implies that if someone preaches a different Jesus or gospel, the Corinthians might bear with that person, showing the danger of false teaching (2 Corinthians 11:4).

questions.question: Paul claims he is not behind the very chiefest apostles. What literary device is Paul using here to assert his authority?
questions.explanation: Paul compares himself to the chief apostles to emphasize his equal status and authority in preaching the gospel (2 Corinthians 11:5).

questions.question: Despite being 'rude in speech,' Paul claims he is not lacking in what?
questions.explanation: Paul contrasts his lack of eloquence with his thorough knowledge and manifestation among the Corinthians (2 Corinthians 11:6).

questions.question: Paul admits to robbing other churches by taking wages from them for what purpose?
options: To do service to the Corinthians
questions.correctAnswer: To do service to the Corinthians
questions.explanation: Paul explains that he accepted support from other churches to serve the Corinthians without burdening them (2 Corinthians 11:8).

questions.question: Who supplied Paul when he was present with the Corinthians and wanted for nothing?
questions.explanation: Paul states that the brethren who came from Macedonia supplied what he lacked while he was with the Corinthians (2 Corinthians 11:9).

questions.question: Paul speaks of 'false apostles' who transform themselves into apostles of Christ. Which figure from the Old Testament is he alluding to by comparing Satan's transformation into an 'angel of light'?
questions.explanation: Paul's description aligns with the traditional identification of Satan as Lucifer, who is said to appear as an angel of light, indicating deceptive appearances (2 Corinthians 11:14).

questions.question: Paul refers to boasting in his weaknesses. What theological principle is illustrated by this self-acknowledgment?
questions.explanation: Paul teaches that boasting in infirmities reveals reliance on God's power, consistent with the paradox of strength in weakness (2 Corinthians 11:30).

questions.question: How many times did Paul receive 'forty stripes save one' from the Jews?
questions.explanation: Paul recounts receiving five instances of forty lashes minus one, a Jewish legal punishment, emphasizing his suffering (2 Corinthians 11:24).

questions.question: Which of the following is NOT one of the perils Paul experienced according to 2 Corinthians 11:26?
questions.explanation: Paul lists various perils but does not mention 'perils of famine,' focusing instead on dangers from people and environments (2 Corinthians 11:26).

questions.question: Paul's escape from Damascus involved being let down by a window in what kind of container?
questions.explanation: Paul describes his escape by being lowered in a basket through a window to evade capture (2 Corinthians 11:33).

questions.question: True or False: Paul admits that he sometimes preaches foolishly but does so with confidence in boasting.
questions.explanation: Paul acknowledges speaking foolishly at times but does so confidently to boast and make his point (2 Corinthians 11:17).

questions.question: Paul claims he is bold where others are bold, especially concerning which subject?
questions.explanation: Paul states he is bold in facing reproach, matching the boldness of others even if it seems foolish (2 Corinthians 11:21).

questions.question: Paul lists suffering from hunger, thirst, cold, and nakedness. What literary device is he using to emphasize the hardships of ministry?
questions.explanation: The repeated listing of hardships creates parallel structure to emphasize the severity of Paul's sufferings (2 Corinthians 11:27).

theological.title: 2 Corinthians Chapter 11 Quiz - Theological Level
theological.description: Deep biblical theology from 2 Corinthians Chapter 11 that unites all believers. Explore foundational truths about God, creation, and humanity.

questions.question: What is the nature of Paul's jealousy over the Corinthians as described in 2 Corinthians 11:2?
options: Godly jealousy, desiring their purity for Christ
questions.correctAnswer: Godly jealousy, desiring their purity for Christ
questions.explanation: Paul expresses godly jealousy because he has espoused them to one husband, Christ, desiring to present them as a chaste virgin (2 Corinthians 11:2). This reflects God's jealousy over His people (Exodus 34:14; James 4:5) and the call for purity in the church (Ephesians 5:25-27; Revelation 19:7-8).

questions.question: According to 2 Corinthians 11:3, what does Paul fear might corrupt the Corinthians?
options: Their minds being corrupted from the simplicity in Christ
questions.correctAnswer: Their minds being corrupted from the simplicity in Christ
questions.explanation: Paul fears that just as the serpent beguiled Eve, the Corinthians' minds might be corrupted from the simplicity that is in Christ (2 Corinthians 11:3). This warns against deception and false doctrine, consistent with warnings in Colossians 2:8, 1 Timothy 6:20, and Matthew 13:19.

questions.question: What does Paul warn against in 2 Corinthians 11:4 concerning false teachers?
options: Preaching another Jesus, receiving another spirit, or another gospel
questions.correctAnswer: Preaching another Jesus, receiving another spirit, or another gospel
questions.explanation: Paul warns that if someone preaches another Jesus or a different gospel or spirit, they should not be tolerated (2 Corinthians 11:4). This reflects the biblical emphasis on the true gospel in Galatians 1:6-9, Acts 4:12, and Jude 1:3.

questions.question: How does Paul describe his own apostleship in comparison to the 'chiefest apostles' in 2 Corinthians 11:5?
options: Not a whit behind the very chiefest apostles
Only a servant, not an apostle
questions.correctAnswer: Not a whit behind the very chiefest apostles
questions.explanation: Paul asserts that he is not inferior to the most eminent apostles (2 Corinthians 11:5), affirming his apostolic authority consistent with Acts 9:15, Romans 1:1, and Galatians 1:1.

questions.question: What does Paul say about his speech and knowledge in 2 Corinthians 11:6?
options: Rude in speech but not in knowledge
questions.correctAnswer: Rude in speech but not in knowledge
questions.explanation: Paul acknowledges his speech may be unpolished yet insists his knowledge is sound (2 Corinthians 11:6), paralleling Acts 18:24-28 and 1 Corinthians 2:1-4 where apostolic authority is based on truth, not eloquence.

questions.question: Why did Paul say he preached the gospel freely according to 2 Corinthians 11:7?
options: To humble himself so others might be exalted
questions.correctAnswer: To humble himself so others might be exalted
questions.explanation: Paul considers his self-abasement as a means to exalt others by preaching freely (2 Corinthians 11:7), reflecting Christ's humility in Philippians 2:5-8 and the call to serve without selfish motives (1 Corinthians 9:18).

questions.question: How did Paul support himself while ministering to the Corinthians, as described in 2 Corinthians 11:8-9?
options: By receiving support from other churches and Macedonian brethren
By charging the Corinthians high fees
By working as a tentmaker only in Corinth
By receiving payment from the Roman government
questions.correctAnswer: By receiving support from other churches and Macedonian brethren
questions.explanation: Paul states he took wages from other churches and received supplies from brethren from Macedonia to avoid burdening the Corinthians (2 Corinthians 11:8-9), consistent with Acts 20:33-35 and 1 Thessalonians 2:9 emphasizing self-support in ministry.

questions.question: What is Paul’s attitude toward boasting as expressed in 2 Corinthians 11:10-11?
options: He will boast in the truth of Christ because he loves the Corinthians
He refuses to boast at all
He boasts to assert authority over the Corinthians
He boasts about his wealth and status
questions.correctAnswer: He will boast in the truth of Christ because he loves the Corinthians
questions.explanation: Paul declares he will not be stopped from boasting in the truth of Christ and assures his love for the Corinthians (2 Corinthians 11:10-11), aligning with the apostolic passion seen in Galatians 4:20 and 1 Corinthians 2:1-5.

questions.question: Who does Paul identify as false apostles in 2 Corinthians 11:13?
options: Deceitful workers transforming themselves into apostles of Christ
questions.correctAnswer: Deceitful workers transforming themselves into apostles of Christ
questions.explanation: Paul warns that false apostles disguise themselves as apostles of Christ but are deceitful (2 Corinthians 11:13), consistent with warnings in Matthew 7:15, Acts 20:29-30, and 2 Peter 2:1.

questions.question: According to 2 Corinthians 11:14-15, how does Satan disguise himself?
questions.explanation: Paul notes Satan transforms into an angel of light, misleading people (2 Corinthians 11:14), consistent with descriptions in Genesis 3:1, 1 Peter 5:8, and Ephesians 6:11 about spiritual deception.

questions.question: What reason does Paul give in 2 Corinthians 11:22-23 for boasting about his sufferings and labors?
options: He wants to show he is more a minister of Christ than others
He wishes to intimidate false teachers
questions.correctAnswer: He wants to show he is more a minister of Christ than others
questions.explanation: Paul claims greater labors and sufferings than others to demonstrate his true apostleship (2 Corinthians 11:22-23), aligning with the pattern of apostolic suffering in Acts 9:16, 2 Timothy 3:12, and Philippians 3:10.

questions.question: Which of the following sufferings did Paul endure as described in 2 Corinthians 11:24-27?
options: Forty stripes save one, shipwrecks, beaten with rods, hunger and thirst
Exile to Rome, imprisonment in Ephesus, blindness
Loss of eyesight, stoning in Jerusalem, exile to Patmos
questions.correctAnswer: Forty stripes save one, shipwrecks, beaten with rods, hunger and thirst
questions.explanation: Paul recounts multiple sufferings including forty stripes save one, shipwrecks, beatings, hunger and thirst (2 Corinthians 11:24-27), consistent with Acts 16:22-34, 2 Timothy 4:6-8, and Philippians 1:29-30 describing apostolic endurance.

questions.question: What is the 'care of all the churches' that Paul mentions in 2 Corinthians 11:28?
options: The daily burden and responsibility for their spiritual wellbeing
questions.correctAnswer: The daily burden and responsibility for their spiritual wellbeing
questions.explanation: Paul describes the daily pressure of caring for the churches' spiritual health (2 Corinthians 11:28), reflecting pastoral responsibility as seen in Acts 20:28, 1 Thessalonians 2:7-8, and Hebrews 13:17.

questions.question: How did Paul escape from Damascus as described in 2 Corinthians 11:32-33?
options: He was let down through a window in a basket
He left in disguise on a horse
He was released by the governor
questions.correctAnswer: He was let down through a window in a basket
questions.explanation: Paul escaped by being lowered in a basket through a window in the city wall to avoid capture (2 Corinthians 11:33), an event also recorded in Acts 9:25, illustrating God's providential protection over His servants.

questions.question: According to 2 Corinthians 11:29-30, what does Paul choose to boast about?
questions.explanation: Paul chooses to boast about his weaknesses to highlight God's power working through human frailty (2 Corinthians 11:29-30), consistent with 2 Corinthians 12:9-10, Isaiah 40:29, and Psalm 34:18.
